Hero.text: {=TAOM_hero_d1}Cadoc the Grim, Chieftain of the Baedd-lûth, is a warrior whose stern visage matches his unyielding will. He has led his clan through countless raids against the horse-lords, earning a fearsome reputation in the valleys of Dunland. His warriors follow him with fanatical devotion, for he has never retreated from battle.

{=TAOM_hero_d2}Morwen of the Baedd-lûth serves as her husband's wisest counselor. While Cadoc leads in war, Morwen manages the clan's affairs in peace, ensuring the survival of their people through harsh winters and lean harvests.

{=TAOM_hero_d3}Fenrik Tuskhewer, son of Cadoc the Grim, has inherited his father's ferocity in battle. Young and eager to prove himself, he leads the clan's raiders with reckless courage that borders on madness.

{=TAOM_hero_d4}Eira Boarsong, daughter of Cadoc the Grim, possesses a voice that can rally the warriors of Dunland to feats of incredible bravery. She sings the old songs of glory before every battle.

{=TAOM_hero_d5}Draug the Seer is the mystical leader of the Gwrach-lûth, a clan steeped in the old ways of Dunland. He communes with spirits and reads omens in the flights of ravens, guiding his people with prophecy and dark wisdom.
{=TAOM_hero_d6}Gwynn Ravenhair is as cunning as her husband is mystical. She manages the Gwrach-lûth's network of spies and informants, gathering intelligence that proves as valuable as any army.

{=TAOM_hero_d7}Branoc Feathershaft combines the mystical traditions of his father with the practical cunning of his mother. He is being groomed to lead the Gwrach-lûth when Draug's visions finally consume him.
{=TAOM_hero_d8}Aelwen the Wise shows signs of the sight that marks her father's line. Young though she is, the spirits whisper secrets to her, and many come seeking her counsel.
{=TAOM_hero_d9}Haldric Talonstrike, master of the Eryr-lûth, holds the high passes of Dunland against all who would threaten his people. His mountain strongholds have never fallen to enemy assault.
{=TAOM_hero_d10}Sifra Stoneheart rules alongside her husband with an iron will. She trains the young warriors of the Eryr-lûth, forging them into the stubborn defenders the mountains require.
{=TAOM_hero_d11}Torvin Highclaw scales the steepest cliffs as easily as walking on flat ground. He leads his father's scouts, watching the borders of Dunland with eagle-sharp eyes.
{=TAOM_hero_d12}Yrla Ghostpelt is still young, but already shows the fierce determination of her parents. She dreams of one day leading raids against the enemies of Dunland.

{=TAOM_hero_dale1}Galden Rivermaster has built the House of the River into one of Dale's wealthiest families. His caravans travel from Erebor to the Iron Hills and beyond, bringing prosperity to all who trade with him.
{=TAOM_hero_dale2}Sigrid Goldweaver manages the family's vast trading empire. Her shrewd negotiations have secured favorable terms with the dwarves of Erebor, who respect her fair dealing.
{=TAOM_hero_dale3}Osven Riverson learns the family trade at his father's side. Though young, he has already negotiated several profitable agreements on his own initiative.
{=TAOM_hero_dale4}Svana Riversdaughter prefers adventure to accounting. She often accompanies the family's caravans, learning the roads and waterways of the region.

{=TAOM_hero_dale5}Vidar Longshot leads the House of the Archers, whose bowmen are famed throughout Dale and beyond. His own skill with the longbow is legendary, and he has trained generations of marksmen.
{=TAOM_hero_dale6}Vitomira Truearrow matches her husband arrow for arrow. Together they have made the House of the Archers a force to be reckoned with in Dale's defense.
{=TAOM_hero_dale7}Lashonek Swiftbow may one day surpass his parents' skill. His arrows fly faster and straighter than any other archer in Dale, earning him fame among the warriors.
{=TAOM_hero_dale8}Zorika Keeneye possesses eyesight that borders on supernatural. She can spot threats at distances others cannot even imagine, making her invaluable as a scout.
{=TAOM_hero_dale9}Svedorn Gatewarden has spent his life defending the approaches to Esgaroth. His knowledge of the waterways and marshes around Long Lake is unmatched.
{=TAOM_hero_dale10}Izdenka Shieldmaiden fights alongside her husband in defense of their home. She has proven that the women of Dale are as fierce as their men in battle.
{=TAOM_hero_dale11}Alvar Irongate inherits his parents' dedication to defense. He strengthens the fortifications around Long Lake, preparing for threats that may come from any direction.
{=TAOM_hero_dale12}Milanka Lakeborn grew up on the waters of Long Lake. She knows every inlet and channel, and can navigate the mists that confuse even experienced sailors.

{=TAOM_hero_h1}Suladan the Golden rules the Tribe of the Serpent with cunning and strength. His warriors are masters of poison and ambush, striking from the desert like vipers and vanishing before retaliation can be mounted.
{=TAOM_hero_h2}Zephara Sandrose is as beautiful as she is deadly. She manages the tribe's network of spies and assassins, ensuring that Suladan's enemies never rest easy.
{=TAOM_hero_h3}Hasharin Serpentfang has trained since childhood in the deadly arts of his people. His blade is swift as a striking cobra, and just as lethal.
{=TAOM_hero_h4}Sahra Moonveil possesses her mother's gift for intrigue. Though young, she already manipulates the politics of the South with surprising skill.
{=TAOM_hero_h5}Inkara Elephantlord commands the great Mumakil of Far Harad. From atop his war tower, he has crushed countless enemies beneath the thundering feet of his beasts.
{=TAOM_hero_h6}Nala Beastwhisper has a mystical connection with the Mumakil. She can calm the most enraged beast and train even the wildest calf to serve in war.
{=TAOM_hero_h7}Turak Mahudson rides the largest Mumak in the tribe's herds. He dreams of leading a charge of war elephants that will shake the very foundations of the North.
{=TAOM_hero_h8}Amara Sunbloom has inherited her mother's gift for working with the great beasts. She tends to the Mumakil calves, raising the next generation of war elephants.
{=TAOM_hero_h9}Razak Bloodblade leads the elite warriors of the Tribe of the Scarlet. His crimson-robed guards are fanatically loyal, sworn to die before allowing harm to come to their masters.
{=TAOM_hero_h10}Yasmin Redveil trains the assassins and spies of the Scarlet Guard. Her agents operate in every court of Harad, gathering secrets and eliminating threats.
{=TAOM_hero_h11}Khaled Scarletson has proven himself in countless duels and battles. He leads his father's personal guard, the most elite warriors of the Scarlet.
{=TAOM_hero_h12}Fatima Crimsonguard follows in her mother's footsteps, learning the arts of espionage and assassination. She is young but already shows promise.
{=TAOM_hero_r1}Elfhelm of the House of Heoruring has served the kings of Rohan since his youth. His riders are the finest in all the Riddermark, and his loyalty to the throne is beyond question.
{=TAOM_hero_r2}Hild Shieldmaiden fights alongside her husband as an equal. She has proven that the women of Rohan are as capable in battle as any man.
{=TAOM_hero_r3}Herubrand Horsemaster has his father's gift with horses. The steeds he trains are among the finest in Rohan, sought after by lords throughout the kingdom.
{=TAOM_hero_r4}Lúowynn Steelflower combines grace with deadly skill. She rides at the head of the household's riders, eager to prove herself in battle.
{=TAOM_hero_r5}Cuthród of the Westfolding guards the Gap of Rohan against the Dunlending raiders. His warriors are hardened by constant battle with the hill folk.
{=TAOM_hero_r6}Eadgifu Stoneheart manages the defenses of the Westfold when her husband rides to war. Her organization ensures that the frontier is always ready for attack.
{=TAOM_hero_r7}Siegeberht Gapwarden has fought the Dunlendings since he was old enough to hold a sword. He knows their ways and can anticipate their attacks.
{=TAOM_hero_r8}Elfhild Westdaughter helps her mother maintain the frontier settlements. She dreams of the day when peace will come to the Westfold.
{=TAOM_hero_r9}Eothain Meararider breeds the finest horses in all of Rohan. His mearas are descended from the legendary Felarof, and are prized throughout the Mark.
{=TAOM_hero_r10}Sunnifa Horsebinder shares her husband's gift with horses. Together they have made the House of Eastemnetring the premier horse breeders of Rohan.
{=TAOM_hero_r11}Ulfeytel Swiftsteed is the fastest rider in the Eastemnet. He serves as a messenger for the king, carrying word across the realm with unmatched speed.
{=TAOM_hero_r12}Wulfwynn Sunmane is still young, but already shows remarkable skill with horses. She is being trained to continue the family's legacy.
{=TAOM_hero_k1}Vazir Shadowblade leads the Zulkârim, the feared assassins and scouts of Khand. His agents operate in every court and camp, gathering intelligence and eliminating threats to the realm.
{=TAOM_hero_k2}Nywin Nightwhisper trains the assassins of the Zulkârim. Her teachings have made them the deadliest killers in all of Khand.
{=TAOM_hero_k3}Ranaon Silentfoot moves through the shadows like a ghost. He has never been detected on a mission, and his victims never see death coming.
{=TAOM_hero_k4}Eilidh Duskdancer combines grace with deadly skill. She is being groomed to lead the Zulkârim's network of spies.
{=TAOM_hero_k5}Pryndor Steelcurve is the master swordsman of the Razûlak. His curved blade has never been bested in single combat, and warriors come from across Khand to study his techniques.
{=TAOM_hero_k6}Floraidh Ironwill matches her husband's skill with a blade of her own. Together they have made the Razûlak the most feared warriors in Khand.
{=TAOM_hero_k7}Aradwyr Swiftedge may one day surpass his parents' skill. His blade is a blur in combat, too fast for most eyes to follow.
{=TAOM_hero_k8}Beitrin Bladesong fights with a grace that seems almost like dancing. Her style is unique among the Razûlak, combining beauty with lethality.
{=TAOM_hero_k9}Luichan Windracer leads the swift raiders of the Dorûmak. His horsemen strike without warning and vanish before any pursuit can be mounted.
{=TAOM_hero_k10}Seonag Duststorm rides at her husband's side on every raid. Her archery from horseback is legendary among the Dorûmak.
{=TAOM_hero_k11}Fenagan Sandrider has inherited his parents' love of swift raids. He leads the younger warriors of the Dorûmak in training exercises.
{=TAOM_hero_k12}Beathag Swifthoof is the fastest rider among the young warriors. She dreams of leading raids of her own someday.

{=TAOM_hero_rh1}Khamul Ironhelm is the mightiest warlord of the Balchothian. His armored cavalry has crushed every army that dared oppose him, and his name is spoken with fear in the lands of the West.
{=TAOM_hero_rh2}Ergene Steelqueen earned her title by riding at the head of the Balchothian charge. She wears armor as heavy as any man's and has never retreated from battle.
{=TAOM_hero_rh3}Bagai Ironrider combines his father's strength with his mother's fearlessness. He leads the vanguard of the Balchothian and is always first to meet the enemy.
{=TAOM_hero_rh4}Tilun Shieldbearer prefers defense to attack, training the heavy infantry in the art of the shield wall. She dreams of building fortresses to rival those of the West.

{=TAOM_hero_rh5}Amdûr Dragonlord claims his lineage stretches back to the lords who first followed Morgoth in the Elder Days. Whether true or not, his warriors believe it, and follow him with fanatical devotion.
{=TAOM_hero_rh6}Chambui Goldenmane is famed for her beauty and her cunning. She manages the Wainriderian's vast wealth and uses gold as effectively as her husband uses steel.
{=TAOM_hero_rh7}Yesum Dragonson bears the weight of his father's legacy. He strives to prove worthy of the Golden Dragon's banner through deeds of honor and valor.
{=TAOM_hero_rh8}Sokhatai Serpentdaughter inherited her mother's gift for intrigue. She serves as the Wainriderian's ambassador, using charm and wit to achieve what armies cannot.
{=TAOM_hero_rh9}Valathmir Steppekhan rules the endless grasslands of eastern Rhun. His horse archers have never been caught by any pursuing force, for they ride like the wind itself.
{=TAOM_hero_rh10}Sevin Bowmaiden can shoot a bird from the sky at full gallop. She trains the young riders of the Sagarthian and none can match her skill with the composite bow.
{=TAOM_hero_rh11}Altu Swiftarrow may be the finest horse archer ever born to the Sagarthian. He can loose three arrows before the first has found its mark.
{=TAOM_hero_rh12}Mela Windrider loves nothing more than racing across the open steppe. She is young but already commands her own squadron of scouts.
